result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob L Bullis

records.addlTxt:
9:11 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jacob L Bullis appeared by video, in custody .  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Jacob L Bullis.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Richards is heard on the status of the cases. Requests a January date. 
State is heard. Awaiting blood test results. Results unlikely to be back before March.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.

8:50 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jacob L Bullis appeared by video.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Jacob L Bullis.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

2022TR000460, 2022TR000461, 2022TR000462, 2022TR000463, 2022TR000464 will continue to track along with the criminal case. 

Atty Richards is heard, waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 

Defendant enters a NG plea as to each of the five traffic cases.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:08 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jacob L Bullis appeared by video.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Jacob L Bullis.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF93 called (2022TR000460, 2022TR000461, 2022TR000462, 2022TR000463, 2022TR000464 tracking along with criminal case) 

Attorney Richards is heard and is ready to proceed with preliminary hearing.

Exam by Attorney Steiner 
Cross by Attorney Richards 
Exam by Attorney Steiner 
No follow up by Attorney Richards.  

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. 
Attorney Richards requests court to find decision. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 
Attorney Richards is ready to proceed today. 
State requests more time before arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Arraignment on August 19, 2022 at 08:45 am.

2:32 PM Cases 22CF93 & TR cases riding along 22TR460, 461, 462, 463 & 464 called together- appearances stated.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Steven Richards

2:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jacob L Bullis appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant qualifies for a public defender.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

State Public Defender's Office indicates Mr. Bullis called their office and he does qualify for a public defender; however, they will not have an attorney available for his hearing on 7/5/22. They will work on appointing once they know his next court date.

9:46 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jacob L Bullis in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on June 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.

TC with Jacob Bullis who has a court appearance 6/13/22 at 1:30 PM.  He lives in Minn. and cannot find a ride to court.  He is requesting that his date be moved out a bit.  JA approved his request and gave him the next court date of Friday (6/17) at 9:45 AM in person.
(Bonded out of Jail pd. $0)
Hearing on June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:57 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jacob Lee Bullis in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $500.00 signature bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with M. Peck. Defendant shall have no contact with C. Khaokaew.

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 signature bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with M. Peck. Defendant shall have no contact with C. Khaokaew.

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with M. Peck or K. Khaokaew
